item.title: Introduction
item.description: Get started # tableauc (protogen) # The tableauc is the tableau compiler with protogen inside, which can convert Excel/CSV/XML files to Protoconf files. Protoconf is a dialect of Protocol Buffers (proto3) extended with tableau options. flowchart LR subgraph Input direction RL I1(Excel) I2(CSV) I3(XML) end Input --> B B((tableauc)):::orangecalss --> C(Protoconf) classDef orangecalss fill:#f96; confgen # flowchart LR A(Protoconf) --> B B((confgen)):::orangecalss --> Output classDef orangecalss fill:#f96; subgraph Output direction RL O1("JSON(protojson)") O2("Text(prototext)") O3("Wire(protowire)") end

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: Requirements # Doks uses npm to centralize dependency management, making it easy to update resources, build tooling, plugins, and build scripts: Download and install Node.js (it includes npm) for your platform. Start a new Doks project # Create a new site, change directories, install dependencies, and start development server. Create a new site # Doks is available as a child theme, and a starter theme: Use the Doks child theme, if you do not plan to customize a lot, and/or need future Doks updates.

item.title: Commands
item.description: ðŸ’¡ You can change the commands in the scripts section of `./package.json`. create # Create new content for your site: npm run create [path] [flags] See also the Hugo docs: hugo new. lint # Check scripts, styles, and markdown for errors: npm run lint scripts # Check scripts for errors: npm run lint:scripts [-- --fix] styles # Check styles for errors: npm run lint:styles [-- --fix] markdown # Check markdown for errors:
